newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysian importers eye corn at $140-$150 a tonne.
newsitem.headline: Malaysian importers eye corn at $140-$150 a tonne.

text.p: Malaysian importers could lock in orders for corn if they can buy it at between $140 and $150 a tonne C&F in the next couple of weeks, traders said on Tuesday.
They said several local importers will be in the market for one or two shipments -- meaning 50,000 to 100,000 tonnes -- of corn for February/March shipment if they can buy below $150.
"The market's always looking out for signs when the international price may go higher, and the signs are coming now," said the sales manager of a flour mill in Kuala Lumpur.
On Tuesday, bulk corn, ex-factory/godown in Malaysia's central region, was quoted at 415 ringgit ($167) a tonne.
A trading source close to Federal Flour Mills Bhd confirmed the company would be "very interested" in securing a couple of corn shipments for between $140 and $150 a tonne.
